Query.SqlString: SELECT Top 32767 ID,Literature FROM Literature WHERE (Literature ='HSK99A')

BibliographicData.Title: Callosal connections of the parabelt auditory cortex in macaque monkeys.

Reference.Quotation: Further the photomicrograph in panel A indicates that this injection may have also involved the lateral belt and the underlying mithe matter, .... (p.860)
Reference.Comments: This injection involved the white matter!

The figure is with out borders and clear brain site names. The injected site was marked on the figure in dorso-ventral direction at the axis of auditory parabelt on STG. In rostro-caudal direction it was marked behind the caudal borders of CL and CM.

Because the tracers vary in sensitivity, the amounts and solution concentrations were varied accordingly (typically, 0.01 to 0.05 µl at 2% for WGA-HRP; 0.1 to 0.3 µl at 2 to 10% for BDA and fluorescent tracers).

Figure with out borders and clear brain site names. The injected site was marked on the figure in dorso-ventral direction at the axis of auditory parabelt on STG. In rostro-caudal direction it was marked near the rostral end of STG. Thus I assume GP83-Ts1

Figure with out borders and clear brain site names. The injected site was marked on the figure in dorso-ventral direction at the axis of auditory parabelt on STG. In rostro-caudal direction it was marked rostral to RTL. Thus I assume GP83-Ts2
